newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka plane crashlands during training flight.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka plane crashlands during training flight.

text.p: One person was killed and another injured when a Sri Lanka Air Force plane crash-landed during a training flight on Saturday, the defence ministry said.
The two-seater plane crash-landed in Talawa area in the district of Anuradhapura, it said.
Anuradhapura is some 200 km (130 miles) north of the capital Colombo. It was not clear if hostile action prompted the emergency landing.
Sri Lanka's tiny airforce has already lost six aircraft this year in combat operations against the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels.
The LTTE are fighting a 13-year-old war against government troops for a separate homeland for minority Tamils in Sri Lanka's north and east.
